rev.comment: I don't know if they are real terminals, get some references to include them back in
rev.diff:
Line 29: Line 29:
[[Mac OS X]] includes [[Terminal (application)|Terminal]] as its default terminal emulator for local access. There are a number of third-party terminal emulators for local access on Mac OS X, such as [[GLTerm]], [[iTerm]], [[MacTelnet]], [[dataComet]], and [[MacWise]]. [[ZTerm]] is a remote-access terminal for the Mac.
[[Mac OS X]] includes [[Terminal (application)|Terminal]] as its default terminal emulator for local access. There are a number of third-party terminal emulators for local access on Mac OS X, such as [[GLTerm]], [[iTerm]], [[MacTelnet]], [[dataComet]], and [[MacWise]]. [[ZTerm]] is a remote-access terminal for the Mac.
â
For the [[X Window System]], there are many different terminal emulators for local access, such as [[xterm]], [[dtterm]], [[Eterm]], [[GNOME Terminal]], [[Konsole]], [[rxvt]], [[mrxvt]], [[wterm]], [[SwitchTerm]], [[TeemTalk]], and [[aterm]].
+
For the [[X Window System]], there are many different terminal emulators for local access, such as [[xterm]], [[Eterm]], [[GNOME Terminal]], [[Konsole]], [[rxvt]], [[mrxvt]], [[wterm]], and [[aterm]].
